dcterms:description: Optimal transport (OT) problems seek the most cost-efficient way to transfer mass between two probability measures.

dcterms:description: Partial Total Variation (P TV) is used in the context of regularized transportation problems.

dcterms:description: Mass-Constrained Optimal Partial Transport (MOPT) is defined for scenarios where mass constraints are applied to the optimal transport problem.
dcterms:title: Mass-Constrained Optimal Partial Transport (MOPT)

dcterms:description: The Generalized Wasserstein Distance is a metric that extends the classical Wasserstein distance to include additional structures.

dcterms:description: Sliced Optimal Partial Transport is a novel approach to optimal transport that incorporates slicing techniques.

dcterms:description: Efficient Solvers for Partial Gromov-Wasserstein provide algorithms for solving transportation problems in the Gromov-Wasserstein framework.
dcterms:title: Efficient Solvers for Partial Gromov-Wasserstein
